titles.title: A joint resolution calling for the United States to support efforts of the United Nations to conclude an international agreement to establish an international criminal court.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S930-931)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Subcommittee on Terrorism, Narcotics & Int. Oper. Hearings held.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported to Senate by Senator Pell without amendment. With written report No. 103-71. Additional and minority views filed.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 112.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S8813-8814)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S11592-11594)
Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 1/28/1993--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the U.S. delegation should make every effort to advance at the United Nations a proposal for establishment of an international criminal court with jurisdiction over crimes of an international character. Directs the President to submit to the Congress a detailed report on developments relating to, and U.S. efforts in support of, the establishment of such court.
